title: Presidential transition of Bill Clinton
added: [[Bill Clinton 1992 presidential campaign|Clinton's presidential campaign]] launched an effort to plan for a prospective presidential transition after [[1992 Democratic National Convention|the Democratic National Convention]]. Clinton chose to have the effort be headed by his campaign chair [[Mickey Kantor]].<ref name="vox">{{cite web |last1=Skinner |first1=Richard |title=Bill Clinton set a bad example with his transition |url=https://www.vox.com/mischiefs-of-faction/2016/10/7/13143186/bill-clinton-transition-bad |website=Vox |access-date=1 February 2021 |language=en |date=7 October 2016}}</ref>
After the election, after tensions between Kantor and Clinton's top campaign staff had arisen, Kantor was dismissed as head of the transition effort.<ref name="vox"/>

The transition was considered chaotic.<ref name="vox"/> The transition was headquartered both in [[Little Rock]], [[Arkansas]] and [[Washington, D.C.]], with this geographic split of the operation creating some problems.<ref name="vox"/> The main decisions tended to be made from the Little Rock headquarters.<ref name="vox"/> The transition's policy advisors were ideologically split between [[centrists]] and [[Liberalism|liberals]].<ref name="vox"/>

Controversy arose when president-elect Clinton indicated support for allowing [[homosexual]] individuals to openly serve in the [[United States Armed Forces]], a stance that was contrary both to the position of the [[Joint Chiefs of Staff]] and Clinton's own [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]].<ref name="vox"/>

title: Presidential transition of Bill Clinton
added: In addition to the $3.5 million the government provided the Clinton transition team, $5.3 million was raised through private contributions to help fund their effort.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Zausner |first1=Robert |title=A new Bush fund appeal |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/179831144/ |website=Newspapers.com |publisher=The Philadelphia Inquirer |access-date=31 January 2021 |language=en |url-access=subscription |date=30 November 2000}}</ref>

title: Presidential transition of Bill Clinton
added: In total, Clinton had roughly 4,000 executive branch positions to make appointments to.<ref name="marshall1"/>

title: Presidential transition of Bill Clinton
added: In total, Clinton had roughly 4,000 executive branch positions to make appointments to, in addition to setting a budget and political agenda.<ref name="marshall1"/>
